titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Edward Emerson Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

chronitem.event: Born in Nashville, Tennessee
Nashville at Poole's Studio
Married Rhoda Calvert; discovered first comet
Student and instructor at Vanderbilt University
Took position at Lick Observatory in California
Discovered 4 comets, several new nebulae, first photographs of Milky Way, eclipse of one 6f Saturn's moons
First to observe return of d'Arrest's comet
Discovered Jupiter's Fifth Satellite
Lalande gold medal, Paris Academy of Sciences
Arago gold medal, Paris Academy
Professor of Practical Astronomy at University of Chicago
Gold medal, Royal Astronomical Society
Janssen gold medal, Paris Academy
Bruce gold medal, Astron. Soc. Pacific
Death, williams Bay, wisconsin Interment. Nashville, TN
Born in Nashville, Tennessee

index.p: This is a name index of the correspondents of Edward Emerson Barnard. The figure ( or figures ) in parentheses immediately following each each name denotes the total number of letters from that person in the collection; the dates are for the time of the letters. The last number given refers to the box in which the correspondence may be found.

did.unittitle: Autobiography. Seven items, incomplete; childhood and early manhood. Typescript. Autobiographical memoranda of E.S. Holden Controversy; fourteen items.
Correspondence - Outgoing. 1,367 letters, 2 cards, 13 telegrams. Chronologically arranged. Holograph, typescript, and carbon copies.
Correspondence - Incoming. Ca. 13,000 letters, cards, and telegrams. Alphabetically arranged. Typescript and holographs.
Published Articles, (Unbound). Arranged alphabetically by journal

note.p: Journals included: American Annual of Photography, American Philosophical Society, Astronomical Journal, Astronomy and Astro-Physics, Astrophysical Journal, Monthly Evening Sky Map, Monthly Notices of the R.A.S., Popular Astronomy, The Vanderbilt Observer

did.unittitle: Published Articles (Bound). Three volumes, Chronologically arranged.
Unpublished Articles. Numerical Catalogue of Messier' Nebular and Clusters; travel articles and notes; fourteen items; holograph and typescript.
Photographs. Astronomical, astronomical equipment, eclipse, Milky Way, miscellaneous, portraits, residences, sky maps, Sumatra trip, sunspots (drawing) 1917 - 1922. •
Miscellaneous. Announcements; invitations; programs; exams while at Vanderbilt University; lectures; lecture notes; newspaper clippings; receipts; research notes; Brashear Memorandum; Autographs.
Material about Edward Emerson Barnard. Bibliographies biographical; nineteen articles written from 1883 - 1964; printed and typescript.
